meanings.definition: To break or cause to break into fragments.
meanings.sent1: The earthquake fragmentates the old building into rubble.
meanings.sent2: She carefully fragmentates the cookie into smaller pieces to share.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef managed to fragmentate the cake into a messy pile.
meanings.sent4: The loud explosion seemed to fragmentate the silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstroke seemed to fragmentate the colors on the canvas.

meanings.definition: To separate into small, disconnected parts.
meanings.sent1: The puzzle fragmentates into many pieces when dropped.
meanings.sent2: The teacher fragmentates the class into groups for a group project.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick seemed to fragmentate the deck of cards.
meanings.sent4: The river's current can fragmentate the soil along its banks.
meanings.sent5: The wind can fragmentate the clouds into different shapes in the sky.

meanings.definition: To disintegrate or shatter into pieces.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the old statue fragmentates due to weathering.
meanings.sent2: The glass vase fragmentates into shards when dropped.
meanings.sent3: The loud music seemed to fragmentate the delicate glassware.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat can fragmentate the rock into smaller pieces.
meanings.sent5: The impact of the hammer can fragmentate the fragile object easily.
